Software
Alban Siffer
Home Bio Research Software Misc

In addition to the research, we try to cleanly distribute our work. You could find several projects on my github, some debian packages on my ppa and also some python3 packages on PyPI, all with GPLv3 license. Below we detail some of them.

libspot

In our work, we developped an algorithm aimed to detect outliers in streaming data: SPOT. libspot is a C++ library which mainly implements it.

We also released python3 bindings to libspot and a pure Go implementation of the library is also available at https://github.com/asiffer/gospot

More details are given on https://asiffer.github.io/libspot/

Furthermore, I currently develop an IDS (Intrusion Detection System) which uses SPOT instances to monitor some network features. I don’t claim it will be better than a signature-based IDS like Snort, Zeek or Suricata. The purpose is to merely make a proof-of-concept that it is possible to do behavioural detection.

libfolding

We have also published a new statistical test aimed to detect whether the distribution of your data is unimodal or multimodal. It works in multidimensional and even streaming data. It is called the Folding Test of Unimodality (or FTU). I developped a C++ library and its python3 bindings too.

More details can be found at https://asiffer.github.io/libfolding/.

Yes, an R package exists too! Initially you can find it on github but recently (october 2018) it has been made available on CRAN through the name Rfolding. This is a pure R package. I apologize for the documentation which is rather minimalist.
